abstract: New York City Sanitation Dept seeks ways to combat theft of valuable recyclables set out for curbside collection; officials are reluctant to crack down on scavengers, who rely on cans and bottles for income, but say city will not be able to reach its diversion rate goals if it cannot collect and track all recyclables.
lead_paragraph: As the city sets new recycling goals, it is cracking down on people and teams who pick metals, cardboard and plastic from the trash and cash them in.

headline.main: New York City Fights Scavengers Over a Treasure: Trash
headline.print_headline: City Fights Scavengers Over a Treasure: Trash

snippet: As the city sets new recycling goals, it is cracking down on people and teams who pick metals, cardboard and plastic from the trash and cash them in.
